Bhandari PCE Module

Quick search

Bellman-Ford PCE Module¶

This module is one of the fundamental pathfinding elements of the PCE, used to compute shortest (least-cost) path routing on a constrained network. The Bellman-Ford Algorithm is one of the most widely adopted routing algorithms because it optimally computes its path, and is able to incorporate negatively weighted edges into its graph model. This module serves as the underlying pathfinding mechanism for the Bhandari PCE Module, which requires negative edge weights. The module is not incorporated into any service-specific PCE modules at this time.

Module Details¶

Calls:

  • N/A

Called By:

  • Bhandari PCE Module

API Specification:

  • BellmanFordPCE
